snippet: What has long been an uneasy peace between the state government and the tribes has degraded with disagreements on a number of issues.
abstract: Native American tribes in Maine express loss of confidence in state government after Gov Paul R LePage rescinds executive order encouraging cooperation between state and tribes and Legislature rejects two major bills proposing tribal casino and shared fishing rights, with some tribes abandoning their legislative seats; trend of dissatisfied Native American tribes seeking sovereignty from states is growing across nation.
lead_paragraph: What has long been an uneasy peace between the state government and the tribes has degraded with disagreements on a number of issues.

headline.main: Maine Native American Tribes Say Trust Is Deteriorating
headline.print_headline: Maine Tribes Say Trust Is Deteriorating
